intro: Melandrium longicarpophorum, commonly known as the long-seeded catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces elongated, slender fruits called follicles, which contain the seeds. It typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Melandrium longicarpophorum is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
